block.p: Jenna LeMieux and Dr. Jonathan Thomas Crocker were married yesterday in Boston. The Rev. Mary E. Conroy, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Trinity Church.

Ms. LeMieux, 33, is keeping her name. She is a student in the M.B.A. program at Harvard. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in social work from Boston University. She is a daughter of Sandra and David M. LeMieux of Wrentham, Mass. Her father is the president of Sinclair Manufacturing, a maker of microelectronics in Chartley, Mass. Her mother was until March the manager of the John Brown House Museum in Providence.
Jenna LeMieux and Dr. Jonathan Thomas Crocker were married yesterday in Boston. The Rev. Mary E. Conroy, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Trinity Church.
Jenna LeMieux and Dr. Jonathan Thomas Crocker were married yesterday in Boston. The Rev. Mary E. Conroy, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Trinity Church.

Ms. LeMieux, 33, is keeping her name. She is a student in the M.B.A. program at Harvard. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in social work from Boston University. She is a daughter of Sandra and David M. LeMieux of Wrentham, Mass. Her father is the president of Sinclair Manufacturing, a maker of microelectronics in Chartley, Mass. Her mother was until March the manager of the John Brown House Museum in Providence.

Dr. Crocker, 35, is an attending physician in internal medicine at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston. He graduated from Amherst College and received his medical degree from the University of Massachusetts. He is a son of Marilyn R. Crocker and the Rev. Joseph H. Crocker of West Newfield, Me. His mother is an educational consultant in West Newfield. His father retired as the minister of the Washington United Methodist Church in Cranston, R.I.
